data.prayer: Father, help media producers communicate the gospel in a way that is understandable to the people of Simiyu, Tanzania.
data.verse: But from there, you will seek the LORD your God, and you will find Him if you search for Him with all your heart and all your soul.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Simiyu, Tanzania

data.prayer: Father, please send teachers of your Word in Simiyu who can speak your gospel boldly and clearly.
Father, guide the church in Simiyu, Tanzania to see their community as a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God.
data.verse: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.

data.prayer: Lord, cause a passion for prayer among the people of Simiyu, Tanzania.
data.verse: I [Jesus] pray also for those who will believe in me through their message, that all of them may be one, Father, just as you are in me and I am in you. May they also be in us so that the world may believe that you have sent me.

data.prayer: Lord God, I thank you that the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without defect to God, can cleanse the Hadzabi people conscience from dead works to serve the living God.
Jesus, help the church in the state of Simiyu to not rely on buildings or programs, but on your Spirit and the simple faithfulness of every believer.
Father, for those in trouble in the state of Simiyu prompt them to call on you for rescue today.
data.verse: He will call on me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble, I will deliver him and honor him.

data.section_summary:
the state of Simiyu, Tanzania has a population of 1,584,200.

We estimate Simiyu has 174,099 people who might know Jesus, 635,646 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 774,455 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 9 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Father, knowing that teachers will be judged more strictly, help the local leaders in Simiyu, Tanzania to be careful with their words.
data.verse: Not many of you should become teachers, my brothers, for you know that we who teach will be judged with greater strictness.
